name: Glen Echo Park
description: Glen Echo Park began in 1891 as a National Chautauqua Assembly "to promote liberal and practical education." By 1911, it transformed into DC's premier amusement park until it closed in 1968. Since 1971, the National Park Service has owned and operated the site and today, with the help of the Glen Echo Park Partnership for Arts and Culture, offers year-round cultural and recreational activities.
shortDescription: Glen Echo Park began in 1891 as a National Chautauqua Assembly "to promote liberal and practical education." By 1911, it transformed into DC's premier amusement park until it closed in 1968. Since 197...

operatingHours.description: The grounds of Glen Echo Park are open daily from 6 a.m. to 1 a.m. (the next day).  No overnight parking.

climate.weatherDescription: Weather for Washington, D.C. and Bethesda, Maryland areas.

images.title: Busy Day outside Carousel
images.altText: groups of families, adults and children strolling in Glen Echo Park near Carousel Building
images.caption: Glen Echo Park and the Dentzel Carousel are enjoyed by children and adults.

images.title: Dancing in the Bumper Car Pavilion
images.altText: outdoor scene of open dance pavilion illuminated and evening dance crowd inside.
images.caption: Evening Dance in the Bumper Car Pavilion

images.title: Labor Day Art Show in Spanish Ballroom
images.altText: people walking around large room during art show
images.caption: Visitors enjoy the Labor Day Art Show which highlights pieces created by students from the Glen Echo Park art programs.

images.title: Glen Echo Park Junior Rangers working on booklet.
images.altText: three children seated at a picnic table working on a Glen Echo Park Junior Ranger Booklet.
images.caption: Completing the Glen Echo Park Junior Ranger Booklet to earn the Junior Ranger Badge.

images.title: Glen Echo Picnic area
images.altText: people gathered at picnic tables enjoying a lunch in Glen Echo Park
images.caption: Glen Echo Park has a large picnic area with many tables, restrooms and a playground.
